document_data.name: Tantan
document_data.mainbody: A '''tantan''', known as a '''tambourine''' on other worlds, was a type of percussion instrument.{{Cite dragon/123/Music of the Forgotten Realms|13}}The tantan appears to bear no relation to the [[Wikipedia:Tan-tan|tan-tan]], a large drum from Brazil.
document_data.Description: Tantans consisted of jangling hoops that were used to emphasize rhythms in ensembles and to enhance campfire dances.
document_data.Availability: Tantans crafted by the masters of the plains of the [[Hordelands]] and traded through [[Semphar]] were available for purchase through ''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue (in-universe)|Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]''.''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]'' states that the tantans are made by "the masters of the plains" and come from "the long trade routes from Semphar" (not necessarily Semphar itself). It is unclear who these masters are and what plains are being referred to, but the most notable plains beyond Semphar are those of the Hordelands.

Notable Users.Individuals:
* [[Adagio Jones]], a member of the [[bard]]ic group [[Adagio Jones and The Goodwinds]], had a tantan that he played to keep time with soft songs.<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/54/The New Rogues Gallery: Adagio Jones and The Goodwinds|8}}
* [[Swen Sigirdson]], a traveling entertainer in [[the Vast]], sometimes played a tantan as part of a small group of musicians.<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/91/The Living City: The Swineherd's House|20}}
Notable Users.Regions & Settlements:
* They were popular instrument among the [[human]]s and [[halfling]]s who lived south of the [[Dalelands]].
* Tantans were quite popular among the people of the Hordelands.
